title: Aeroponic Lettuce Farming: Agriculture with Less Water  #WaterConservation #LettuceFarming

tasks.task: Start the tractor and drive it through the field to plant seeds.
subtasks: Check the tractor's fuel level.
Insert the key into the ignition and turn it to start the engine.
Adjust the tractor's speed while driving through the field.
Guide the tractor using the steering wheel to follow the correct path.
Engage the tractor's transmission to the appropriate gear.
Operate the hydraulic lever to lower or raise the planting mechanism.

tasks.task: Plant seeds in the field with the tractor.
subtasks: Align the planting rig with the direction of travel.
Set the proper depth for the seeds using the depth wheel or hydraulic system.
Ensure even planting by maintaining consistent speed and pressure.
Monitor the seed count and quality in the hopper.
Adjust the seed rate if necessary.
Connect the fertilizer granular attachment to the tractor.
Set the fertilizer application rate based on the crop and soil test.
Operate the fertilizer spreader to distribute the product evenly across the field.
Check for proper spacing and overlap to avoid skips or overlaps.
Attach the herbicide sprayer to the tractor.
Fill the sprayer tank with herbicide.
Set the appropriate pressure and nozzles for the herbicide application.
Monitor the spray pattern and make adjustments as needed.
Keep the sprayer moving at a consistent speed to avoid over-application in one area.

tasks.task: Cut the alfalfa for hay using the mower.
subtasks: Align the mower blades correctly before starting.
Start the mower engine and set the speed for operation.
Drive the tractor pulling the mower through the alfalfa field.
Ensure even cutting height by adjusting the mower lift control.
Check the mower for debris and uncut stems, and make passes if necessary.

tasks.task: B Bundle the cut alfalfa into windrows.
subtasks: Drive the tractor with the windrowheader attachment through the cut field.
Adjust the header width and height for optimal windrow formation.
Monitor the windrows to ensure they are properly formed and free of under-cut or over-cut areas.
Position the baler in the windrows and lower the pickup reels.
Start the baler and adjust the clamp pressure.
Embargo new bales by moving the tractor and baler.
Check bales for roundness and size, adjust settings if needed.

tasks.task: Wrap and store the alfalfa bales.
subtasks: Lay plastic wrap around the bales.
Use straps or twine to secure the plastic around each bale.
Stack the bales in a dry, sheltered area if possible to protect them from moisture.
